comments:

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 104237 ***
whoops...didn't mean to dup it.
Does anyone have a repeatible scenario?  I haven't seen this error before.

Although the problem is reproducable it is not consistently reproducable. We
seem to reproduce it nightly in our BVT tests. It appears to be completely
random happing on different testcases each time, about 2-5 out of ~1000
testcases will exibit this problem at random intervals it is believed to be some
sort of race condition scenario.

Here's another one we hit once in a blue moon while importing an EJB jar:

*** Bug 115830 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Chuck, please take a look at the stacks in

*** Bug 115900 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

All of the threading bugs that I have seen so far have one Class in common on the stack:   That is "StructureEdit", and its access to the underlying EMF resource and edit model.

I have carefully reduced direct access to the editmodel and have placed all access in synchronized blocks, that now also checks for disposal before using the underlying editmodel instance.

I have created a multithreaded test case that loades/changes/saves the model using structure edit api, and have verified these fixes synchronize the access properly.

I am releasing the code to both I and M streams today.  All originators please verify.

Chuck - Thanks for your work on this, I will check it out as soon as I can! Do you think your fix will also help cases such as https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=115821 ? Or are you treating that as a separate issue since StructureEdit is not on the stack...?

Hi Tom, your correct this bugzilla (115821) is loading another file, and isn't related to these fixes which deal with a specific Resource accessed in limited api, so we'll keep it open - have you seen this lately?

I'm afraid this will be a much more challenging problem to fix as there are numerous ways to access this model, and I would love an EMF solution provided where we could ensure synchronization at the Resource level.

This bug was moved to 'closed' state, since it is so old its assumed fixed and no longer useful or need further attention. Feel free to re-open, or open a new bug, if this semi-automatic processing was done in error.
